sen.j: 田辺 元（たなべ はじめ、1885年2月3日 - 1962年4月29日）は、日本の哲学者。
sen.e: Hajime TANABE (February 3, 1885-April 29, 1962) was a Japanese philosopher.
Hajime TANABE (田辺元) (February 3, 1885 - April 29, 1962) was a Japanese philosopher.
sen.cmt: Added spacesAdded '(田辺元)' for consistency with following cell.
sen.e: Hajime TANABE (田辺元) (February 3, 1885 - April 29, 1962) was a Japanese philosopher.

sen.j: 旧字体で表記した場合は田邊元となる。
sen.e: His name is expressed as 田邊元 in old character form.
His name is written '田邊元' using the old character form.
His name is written '田邊元' using the old character form.

sen.j: 西田幾多郎とともに京都学派を代表する思想家。
sen.e: He was a thinker who represents the Kyoto school with Kitaro NISHIDA.He became a member of the Japan Academy in 1947 and received the Order of Cultural Merit in 1950.
Along with Kitaro NISHIDA, he was a thinker representative of the Kyoto School.
Along with Kitaro NISHIDA, he was a thinker representative of the Kyoto School.

sen.j: 1947年日本学士院会員、1950年文化勲章受章。
sen.e: He became a member of the Japan Academy in 1947 and received the Order of Cultural Merit in 1950.
He became a member of the Japan Academy in 1947 and received the Order of Cultural Merit in 1950.
He became a member of the Japan Academy in 1947 and received the Order of Cultural Merit in 1950.

sen.j: 東京に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Tokyo.
He was born in Tokyo.
He was born in Tokyo.

sen.j: 父は、東京の開成中学校・高等学校の校長を務め、逗子開成中学校・高等学校や鎌倉女学院を設立した田辺新之助。
sen.e: His father was Shinnosuke TANABE who served as the master of Kaisei Junior and Senior High School in Tokyo and established Zushi Kaisei Junior and Senior High School and Kamakura Jogakuin Junior and Senior High School.

His father was Shinnosuke TANABE who served as the master of Kaisei Junior and Senior High School in Tokyo and established Zushi Kaisei Junior and Senior High School and Kamakura Jogakuin Junior and Senior High School.

His father was Shinnosuke TANABE who served as the master of Kaisei Junior and Senior High School in Tokyo and established Zushi Kaisei Junior and Senior High School and Kamakura Jogakuin Junior and Senior High School.

sen.j: 東京帝国大学理科に入学後、文科哲学科に転科、卒業。
sen.e: He entered the science department of the Tokyo Imperial University, changed to the department of philosophy, humanities, and graduated.
He enrolled in the university of Tokyo first as a natural sciences student, then moved to literature and philosophy.
He enrolled in the university of Tokyo first as a natural sciences student, then moved to literature and philosophy.

sen.j: 東北帝国大学講師に就任。
sen.e: He became a lecturer of Tohoku Imperial University.
He later became a lecturer of Tohoku Imperial University.
He later became a lecturer of Tohoku Imperial University.

sen.j: 著書に、『哲学入門』、『哲学通論』、『懺悔道としての哲学』などがある。
sen.e: His works include "哲学入門(Introduction to the philosophy)", "哲学通論(Outline of the philosophy)" and "懺悔道としての哲学(Philosophy as Metanoetics)".
sen.cmt: 哲学入門はインターネットからIntroduction to the philosophy、懺悔道としての哲学はPhilosophy as Metanoeticsとしました。哲学通論はOutline of the philosophyと仮訳しました。
sen.e: His works include "Tetsugaku Nyumon" (An Introduction to Philosophy), "Tetsugaku Tsuron" (An Outline of Philosophy) and "Zangedo to Shite no Tetsugaku" (Philosophy as Metanoia).
His works include "Tetsugaku Nyumon" (An Introduction to Philosophy), "Tetsugaku Tsuron" (An Outline of Philosophy) and "Zangedo to Shite no Tetsugaku" (Philosophy as Metanoia).

sen.j: 「種の論理」もしくは、「絶対媒介の哲学」を唱え、晩年には懺悔道を説くも、日本の戦争責任を懺悔道という捉えようのない普遍の中に解消してしまったとの批判もある。
sen.e: He advocated 'Logic of species' or 'Philosophy of absolute intermediation' and set forth metanoetics in his last years, but some criticized him that the war responsibility of Japan was made ambiguous in universalization called metanoetics which was difficult to understand.
sen.cmt: 絶対媒介の哲学は、Philosophy of absolute intermediationと仮訳しました。
sen.e: He argued for 'Logic of species', or 'Philosophy of absolute intermediation', and advocated metanoia in his last years, but some criticized that the Japan's war responsibility was made ambiguous in the complicated universalization of metanoetics.

He argued for 'Logic of species,' or 'Philosophy of absolute intermediation,' and advocated metanoia in his last years, but some criticized that the Japan's war responsibility was made ambiguous in the complicated universalization of metanoetics.

sen.j: 京都大学教授の西田幾多郎は、みずからの後継者として田辺を京大に招聘して助教授として迎え入れた。
sen.e: The professor of Kyoto University, Kitaro NISHIDA, invited Tanabe to the university as his successor and made him an assistant professor.
The professor of Kyoto University, Kitaro NISHIDA, invited Tanabe to the university as his successor and made him an assistant professor.
The professor of Kyoto University, Kitaro NISHIDA, invited Tanabe to the university as his successor and made him an assistant professor.

sen.j: こののち、田辺の思索は、西田の影響を受けるようになる。
sen.e: After that, the thoughts of Tanabe were influenced by Nishida.
Following this, the thoughts of Tanabe were influenced by Nishida.
Following this, the thoughts of Tanabe were influenced by Nishida.

sen.j: 晩年、作家の野上弥生子と密かな恋愛関係にあったことが最近判明。
sen.e: It turned out recently that he had a secret love affair with a writer Yaeko NOGAMI in his last years.
It recently came to light that he had a secret love affair with writer Yaeko NOGAMI in his last years.
It recently came to light that he had a secret love affair with writer Yaeko NOGAMI in his last years.

sen.j: その往復書簡300通余りが岩波書店から刊行されている。
sen.e: Their about 300 letters were published from Iwanami Shoten.
Approximately 300 of their letters have been published by Iwanami Shoten.
Approximately 300 of their letters have been published by Iwanami Shoten.

sen.j: 田辺の弟子に辻村公一、高山岩男、唐木順三、土井虎賀寿などがいる。
sen.e: Tanabe had disciples, such as Koichi TSUJIMURA, Iwao KOYAMA, Junzo KARAKI, and Torakazu TOI.
Tanabe's disciples included Koichi TSUJIMURA, Iwao KOYAMA, Junzo KARAKI and Torakazu TOI.
Tanabe's disciples included Koichi TSUJIMURA, Iwao KOYAMA, Junzo KARAKI and Torakazu DOI.

sen.j: 年譜
sen.e: Chronological list of the main events
Chronology
Chronology

sen.j: 1885年 東京に生まれる
sen.e: 1885 He was born in Tokyo.
1885: Born in Tokyo.
1885: Born in Tokyo.

sen.j: 1904年 府立四中（現東京都立戸山高等学校）を経て第一高等学校 (旧制)理科首席卒、東京大学理科大学数学科に入学
sen.e: 1904 He entered Tokyo Fourth Prefectural Middle School (present Tokyo Metropolitan Toyama High School)and graduated first on the list from the science department of Daiichi High School (the first old-education-system high school) and entered the college of science of the Tokyo University.
sen.cmt: 旧制東京府立第一中学校は、former Tokyo First Prefectural Middle Schoolとインターネットにありましたので、東京府立第四中学校はTokyo Fourth Prefectural Middle Schoolとしました。
sen.e: 1904: Entered Tokyo Fourth Prefectural Middle School (present Tokyo Metropolitan Toyama High School), graduated first top of the science department of Daiichi High School (the first old-education-system high school), and entered the college of science at Tokyo University.

1904: Entered Tokyo Fourth Prefectural Middle School (present Tokyo Metropolitan Toyama High School), graduated first top of the science department of Daiichi High School (the first old-education-system high school), and entered the college of science at Tokyo University.

sen.j: 1908年 東京帝国大学文科大学哲学科卒
sen.e: 1908 He was graduated from the department of philosophy of Tokyo Imperial University.
1908: Graduated from the department of philosophy of Tokyo Imperial University.
1908: Graduated from the department of philosophy of Tokyo Imperial University.

sen.j: 1913年 東北帝国大学理学部講師に就任
sen.e: 1913 He became a lecturer of the department of science of Tohoku Imperial University.
1913: Became a lecturer at the department of science of Tohoku Imperial University.
1913: Became a lecturer at the department of science of Tohoku Imperial University.

sen.j: 1916年 アンリ・ポアンカレの『科学の価値』を翻訳
sen.e: 1916 He translated "Value of Science" by Jules-Henri Poincaré into Japanese.
1916: Translated Henri Poincaré's "La Valeur de la Science" (The Value of Science) into Japanese.
1916: Translated Henri Poincaré's "La Valeur de la Science" (The Value of Science) into Japanese.

sen.j: 1918年 京都帝国大学で『数理哲学研究』により文学博士号を取得
sen.e: 1918 He received the degree of Doctor of Literature for his study of mathematical philosophy from Kyoto Imperial University.
1918: Received a doctorate in literature for his study of mathematical philosophy from Kyoto Imperial University.
1918: Received a doctorate in literature for his study of mathematical philosophy from Kyoto Imperial University.

sen.j: 1919年 西田幾多郎の働きにより京都帝国大学文学部助教授に就任
sen.e: 1919 He became assistant professor of the department of literature of Kyoto Imperial University with assistance of Kitaro NISHIDA.
1919: Became an assistant professor at the department of literature of Kyoto Imperial University with the assistance of Kitaro NISHIDA.
1919: Became an assistant professor at the department of literature of Kyoto Imperial University with the assistance of Kitaro NISHIDA.

sen.j: 1922年 ドイツに留学しエドムント・フッサール、マルティン・ハイデッガーと交流。
sen.e: 1922 He studied in Germany and interacted with Edmund Gustav Albrecht Husserl and Martin Heidegger.
1922: Studied in Germany where he interacted with Edmund Gustav Albrecht Husserl and Martin Heidegger.
1922: Studied in Germany where he interacted with Edmund Gustav Albrecht Husserl and Martin Heidegger.

sen.j: 1927年 京都帝国大学文学部教授に就任
sen.e: 1927 He became a professor of the department of literature of Kyoto Imperial University.
1927: Became a professor at the department of literature of Kyoto Imperial University.
1927: Became a professor at the department of literature of Kyoto Imperial University.

sen.j: 1928年 マックス・プランクの『物理学的世界像の統一』を翻訳
sen.e: 1928 He translated "Integration of physical world views" by Max Karl Ernst Ludwig Planck into Japanese.
sen.cmt: 物理学的世界像の統一は、Integration of physical world viewsと仮訳しました。
sen.e: 1928: Translated Max Planck's "Die Einheit des physikalischen Weltbildes" (The Unity of the Physical World Picture) into Japanese.
1928: Translated Max Planck's "Die Einheit des physikalischen Weltbildes" (The Unity of the Physical World Picture) into Japanese.

sen.j: 1935年 『種の論理と世界図式』を発表
sen.e: 1935 He published "Logic of species and world schema".
sen.cmt: 種の論理と世界図式はLogic of species and world schemaと訳しました。
sen.e: 1935: Published "Shu no Ronri to Sekai Zushiki" (The Logic of Species and the World Schema).
1935: Published "Shu no Ronri to Sekai Zushiki" (The Logic of Species and the World Schema).

sen.j: 1945年 京都帝国大学文学部教授退官
sen.e: 1945 He retired from the professor of the department of literature of Kyoto Imperial University.
1945: Retired as professor of the department of literature of Kyoto Imperial University.
1945: Retired as professor of the department of literature of Kyoto Imperial University.

sen.j: 1946年 『懺悔道としての哲学』を出版
sen.e: 1946 He published "Philosophy as Metanoetics".
1946: Published "Zangedo to Shite no Tetsugaku" (Philosophy as Metanoia).
1946: Published "Zangedo to Shite no Tetsugaku" (Philosophy as Metanoia).

sen.j: 1957年 フライブルク大学から名誉博士号を受ける
sen.e: 1957 He received the degree of an honorary doctor from the Freiburg University.
1957: Received an honorary doctorate from Freiburg University.
1957: Received an honorary doctorate from Freiburg University.

sen.j: 1962年 4月29日逝去
sen.e: 1962 He died on April 29.
1962: He died on April 29.
1962: He died on April 29.
